definition: apatosaurus/former name: brontosaurus/also called 雷龍|雷龙[lei2 long2]

sentences.english: Putin\'s rise continues to perplex even devoted Kremlin observers.
sentences.chinese: 普京的崛起至今讓克林姆林宮的觀察家們感到迷惑。

sentences.english: He was still puzzled by who’d interfered.
sentences.chinese: 他還有點迷惑是誰幹涉了。

sentences.english: Mistakes live in the neighbourhood of truth and therefore delude us.
sentences.chinese: 錯誤與真理毗鄰而居，所以會迷惑我們。

sentences.english: Thank you for never being sarcastic The thing that baffles and bewilders a child.
sentences.chinese: 感謝您從不冷嘲熱諷孩子眼中感到迷惑茫然的事情。

sentences.english: Why everybody liked him was what puzzled Jo, at first.
sentences.chinese: 首先，爲什麼每個人都喜歡教授，這令喬迷惑不解。

sentences.english: He was baffled by their lack of enthusiam .
sentences.chinese: 他對他們缺少激情的狀態感到很迷惑。

sentences.english: The labyrinths were supposed to confound any enemies who might get in.
sentences.chinese: 迷宮應該是爲了迷惑入侵的敵人而建。

sentences.english: In the animal kingdom, looks can be deceiving.
sentences.chinese: 在動物的王國裏，外表是能夠迷惑人的。

sentences.english: It was a puzzling remark and still leaves me a little puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個令人迷惑的描述，仍然讓我感到一點兒困惑。

sentences.english: Confused people worry, because too close, and think too much.
sentences.chinese: 人們煩惱迷惑，實因看得太近，而又想得太多。

sentences.english: A wise man is superior to flattery.
sentences.chinese: 一個智者是不會被阿諛奉承所迷惑的。
這個問題使我迷惑不解。

sentences.english: His timing was poor, to say the least, and his motives will mystify many.
sentences.chinese: 他沒多少時間，至少他的動機令大家迷惑。

sentences.english: It baffled me that he rejected my offer.
sentences.chinese: 他拒絕我的建議使我迷惑不解。

sentences.english: It absolutely was. I never wanted to confuse an audience.
sentences.chinese: 確實是這樣，我從來都不想迷惑觀衆。

sentences.english: The officer looked, then shook his head in puzzlement.
sentences.chinese: 那個職員看了看，迷惑的搖了搖頭。

definition: to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to not understand/to be puzzled by/indissoluble
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
